derivation.yuyuan_name: late 16th cent.: via Latin from Greek paian 'hymn of thanksgiving to Apollo' (invoked by the name Paian, originally the Homeric name for the physician of the gods)

entry.def: A paean is a piece of music, writing, or film that expresses praise, admiration, or happiness.

means.word_mean: 2. (ancient Greece) a hymn of praise (especially one sung in ancient Greece to invoke or thank a deity)
